result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew James Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew James Evans in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court restates recommendations.  Parties are in agreement.  Atty Raabe makes statement.  Parties discuss jail credit.  Court sentences.

16CT2
Ct 1:  
20 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
May serve in Columbia Co if accepted
To commence on or before 11/7/2016 at 6:30 pm
$894.00 fine/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan w/Clerk of Court's Office
DNA sample to be provided

16CM9
Ct 2:
60 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
May serve in Columbia Co if accepted
$453.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan w/Clerk of Court's Office
DNA sample to be provided

Parties to provide written stipulation to Br 3 within two weeks re: sentence credit
Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew James Evans in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe notes offers were rec'd and DE would be willing to accept those offers if they're still available.  Parties discuss off the record.  Back on the record, Atty Raabe states matters are resolved and would request plea only today and reset for sentencing so DE can serve jail sentence after his work season is done on/about November 1.  State doesn't object.  Atty Raabe states agreement on the record.  State is in agreement.  Atty Raabe enters NC pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Matter set for sentencing.  Bond continued pending sentencing.  

RECOMMENDATIONS ONLY:

16CM9
Ct 2:  NC
60 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
$453.00 costs/surcharges 
DNA sample to be provided
Cts 1 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

16CT2
Ct 1:  NC
20 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
$894.00 fine/surcharges
DNA sample to be provided
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew James Evans in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe requests warrant be quashed as DE states he didn't know he was required to be here for the FPT.  Believes matter will be resolved.  Court quashes warrant.  Matter reset for RD on 7/18 to track w/another matter.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Raabe states DE failed to appear at a prior motion hearing last week.  No contact.  State requests warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  Remove from trial calendar.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motions. Motion to bring up prior convictions if goes to trial - 17 convictions.  Atty. Raabe has no objection. Motions to admit.  Atty. Raabe objects or hold off on ruling thought DE would be here today and take the offer.
Motion hearing on June 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
to allow impeachment by proof of conviction for crimes
for statements of ME to officers
Jury trial on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe states 16CT2 has an authorization that should apply to this one as well.  State notes they're ok w/that but would like to know where DE is as this is set for FPT and DE is supposed to appear.  State wouldn't object to a reset.  Atty Raabe does request reset of FPT/JT.  Court grants request.  Bond continued.

Attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'rourke filed authorization in 16CM2 and requests that apply to this case as well.  Court so orders.  Atty O'Rourke pleads NG.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continues.

Pre-trial conference at 02-05-2016 09:00 am.
Return date at 02-16-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew James Evans by video from LEC with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Matthew James Evans in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Raabe responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to operate MV w/o valid DL and not to go to Farm & Fleet in Baraboo.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
